original_title: World Bank VP meets Sri Lanka President on reform support
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe had met visiting World Bank Vice President Martin Raiser on planned reforms programs which will be supported by the lender.

Planned reforms included financial supervision, debt management, tax administration, reducing the risk of sovereign bank nexus, banking sector stability, reducing policy uncertainty, improving the competitiveness of the economy and improving a social safety net.

The World Bank is expected to provide budget support loans with the reforms as prior actions once the International Monetary Fund approves a 2.9 billion US dollar bailout along with debt re-structuring. (Colombo/Mar01/2023)
